member.summary: Reader for the JSON format (http://www.json.org) that supports look-ahead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader
member.summary: Reader for the JSON format. http://www.json.org

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.InitialCharacterBufferSize
member.summary: The initial size of the buffer of characters.
member.remarks: 4K (page size) divided by the size of a single character 2 and a little less so that array structures also fit into that page. The goal is for the entire buffer to fit into one page so that we don't cause too many L1 cache misses.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.MaxCharacterCountToMove
member.summary: Maximum number of characters to move in the buffer. If the current token size is bigger than this, we will allocate a larger buffer.
member.remarks: This threshold is copied from the XmlReader implementation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.reader
member.summary: The text reader to read input characters from.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.isIeee754Compatible
member.summary: If it is IEEE754Compatible, read quoted string for INT64 and decimal; otherwise read number directly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.scopes
member.summary: Stack of scopes.
member.remarks: At the beginning the Root scope is pushed to the stack and stays there for the entire parsing (so that we don't have to check for empty stack and also to track the number of root-level values) Each time a new object or array is started the Object or Array scope is pushed to the stack. If a property inside an Object is found, the Property scope is pushed to the stack. The Property is popped once we find the value for the property. The Object and Array scopes are popped when their end is found.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.allowAnnotations
member.summary: true if annotations are allowed and thus the reader has to accept more characters in property names than we do normally; otherwise false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.endOfInputReached
member.summary: End of input from the reader was already reached.
member.remarks: This is used to avoid calling Read on the text reader multiple times even though it already reported the end of input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.characterBuffer
member.summary: Buffer of characters from the input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.storedCharacterCount
member.summary: Number of characters available in the input buffer.
member.remarks: This can have value of 0 to characterBuffer.Length.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.tokenStartIndex
member.summary: Index into the characterBuffer which points to the first character of the token being currently processed (while in the Read method) or of the next token to be processed (while in the caller code).
member.remarks: This can have value from 0 to storedCharacterCount.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.nodeType
member.summary: The last reported node type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.nodeValue
member.summary: The value of the last reported node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.stringValueBuilder
member.summary: Cached string builder to be used when constructing string values (needed to resolve escape sequences).
member.remarks: The string builder instance is cached to avoid excessive allocation when many string values with escape sequences are found in the payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader,Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The text reader to read input characters from.
The specific JSON-based format expected by the reader.
If it is isIeee754Compatible

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next node from the input.
member.returns: true if a new node was found, or false if end of input was reached.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.IsWhitespaceCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines if a given character is a whitespace character.
member.param: The character to test.
member.returns: true if the is a whitespace; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Note that the behavior of this method is different from Char.IsWhitespace, since that method returns true for all characters defined as whitespace by the Unicode spec (which is a lot of characters), this one on the other hand recognizes just the whitespaces as defined by the JSON spec.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseValue
member.summary: Parses a "value", that is an array, object or primitive value.
member.returns: The node type to report to the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseProperty
member.summary: Parses a property name and the colon after it.
member.returns: The node type to report to the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseStringPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses a primitive string value.
member.returns: The value of the string primitive value.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the opening quote. Note that the string parsing can never end with EndOfInput, since we're already seen the quote. So it can either return a string succesfully or fail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseStringPrimitiveValue(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Parses a primitive string value.
member.param: Set to true if the first character in the string was a backslash. This is used when parsing DateTime values since they must start with an escaped slash character (\/).
member.returns: The value of the string primitive value.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the opening quote. Note that the string parsing can never end with EndOfInput, since we're already seen the quote. So it can either return a string succesfully or fail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseNullPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses the null primitive value.
member.returns: Always returns null if successful. Otherwise throws.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the 'n' character.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseBooleanPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses the true or false primitive values.
member.returns: true of false boolean value if successful. Otherwise throws.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the 't' or 'f' character.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseNumberPrimitiveValue
member.summary: Parses the number primitive values.
member.returns: Parse value to Int32, Decimal or Double. Otherwise throws.
member.remarks: Assumes that the current token position points to the first character of the number, so either digit, dot or dash.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ParseName
member.summary: Parses a name token.
member.returns: The value of the name token.
member.remarks: Name tokens are (for backward compat reasons) either - string value quoted with double quotes. - string value quoted with single quotes. - sequence of letters, digits, underscores and dollar signs (without quoted and in any order).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.EndOfInput
member.summary: Called when end of input is reached.
member.returns: Always returns false, used for easy readability of the callers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.PushScope(Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType)
member.summary: Creates a new scope of type and pushes the stack.
member.param: The scope type to push.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.PopScope
member.summary: Pops a scope from the stack.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.TryPopPropertyScope
member.summary: Pops a property scope if it's present on the stack.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.SkipWhitespaces
member.summary: Skips all whitespace characters in the input.
member.returns: true if a non-whitespace character was found in which case the tokenStartIndex is pointing at that character. false if there are no non-whitespace characters left in the input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.EnsureAvailableCharacters(System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures that a specified number of characters after the token start is available in the buffer.
member.param: The number of character after the token to make available.
member.returns: true if at least the required number of characters is available; false if end of input was reached.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ConsumeTokenToString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Consumes the characters starting at the start of the token and returns them as a string.
member.param: The number of characters after the token start to consume.
member.returns: The string value of the consumed token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ReadInput
member.summary: Reads more characters from the input.
member.returns: true if more characters are available; false if end of input was reached.
member.remarks: This may move characters in the characterBuffer, so after this is called all indeces to the characterBuffer are invalid except for tokenStartIndex.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.Value
member.summary: The value of the last reported node.
member.remarks: This is non-null only if the last node was a PrimitiveValue or Property. If the last node is a PrimitiveValue this property returns the value: - null if the null token was found. - boolean if the true or false token was found. - string if a string token was found. - DateTime if a string token formatted as DateTime was found. - Int32 if a number which fits into the Int32 was found. - Double if a number which doesn't fit into Int32 was found. If the last node is a Property this property returns a string which is the name of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.NodeType
member.summary: The type of the last node read.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.IsIeee754Compatible
member.summary: if it is IEEE754 compatible

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType
member.summary: Various scope types for Json writer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Root
member.summary: Root scope - the top-level of the JSON content.
member.remarks: This scope is only once on the stack and that is at the bottom, always. It's used to track the fact that only one top-level value is allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Array
member.summary: Array scope - inside an array.
member.remarks: This scope is pushed when [ is found and is active before the first and between the elements in the array. Between the elements it's active when the parser is in front of the comma, the parser is never after comma as then it always immediately processed the next token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Object
member.summary: Object scope - inside the object (but not in a property value).
member.remarks: This scope is pushed when { is found and is active before the first and between the properties in the object. Between the properties it's active when the parser is in front of the comma, the parser is never after comma as then it always immediately processed the next token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.ScopeType.Property
member.summary: Property scope - after the property name and colon and throughout the value.
member.remarks: This scope is pushed when a property name and colon is found. The scope remains on the stack while the property value is parsed, but once the property value ends, it's immediately removed so that it doesn't appear on the stack after the value (ever).

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.JsonReader.Scope
member.summary: Class representing scope information.

member.summary: The type of the scope.

member.summary: Gets the scope type for this scope.

member.summary: Puts the reader into the state where no buffering happen on read. Either buffered nodes are consumed or new nodes are read (and not buffered).

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.BufferingJsonReader.StartBufferingAndTryToReadInStreamErrorPropertyValue(Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataError@)
member.summary: A method to detect whether the current property value represents an in-stream error.
member.param: The read from the payload.
member.returns: true if the current value is an in-stream error value; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.BufferingJsonReader.ReadInternal
member.summary: Reads the next node from the input. If we have still nodes in the buffer, takes the node from there. Otherwise reads a new node from the underlying reader and buffers it (depending on the current mode).
member.returns: true if a new node was found, or false if end of input was reached.
member.remarks: If the parsingInStreamError field is false, the method will read ahead for every StartObject node read from the input to check whether the JSON object represents an in-stream error. If so, it throws an . If false, this check will not happen. This parsingInStremError field is set to true when trying to parse an in-stream error; in normal operation it is false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.BufferingJsonReader.ProcessObjectValue
member.summary: Called whenever we find a new object value in the payload. The base class implementation reads ahead and tries to parse it as an in-stream error payload. If it finds one it will throw it.
member.remarks: This method is called when the reader is in the buffering mode and can read ahead (buffering) as much as it needs to once it returns the reader will be returned to the position before the method was called. The reader is always positioned on a start object when this method is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Json.BufferingJsonReader.ReadNextAndCheckForInStreamError
member.summary: Reads the next node from the JSON reader and if a start-object node is detected starts reading ahead and tries to parse an in-stream error.
member.returns: true if a new node was found, or false if end of input was reached.

member.param: An instance that was read from the reader or null if none could be read.
member.returns: true if an instance that was read; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.Reorder
member.summary: Reorders the buffered properties to conform to the required payload order.
member.remarks: The required order is: odata.context comes first, odata.type comes next, then all odata.* property annotations and finally, we preserve the relative order of custom annotations and data properties.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.SortBufferedProperties(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Microsoft.OData.Core.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedProperty})
member.summary: Sort the data properties and property annotations stored for a particular property name.
member.param: The list of buffered properties to sort.
member.returns: The sorted enumerable of buffered properties.
member.remarks: The sort order is for all odata.* property annotations to come before the data property but otherwise preserve the relative order of custom property annotations with regard to the position of the data property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.JsonLight.ReorderingJsonReader.BufferedObject.SortPropertyNames
member.summary: Sorts the property names for an object.
member.returns: The sorted enumerable of property names.
member.remarks: The sort order is to put odata.context first, then odata.type, odata.id, and odata.etag, followed by all other odata.* instance annotations. For the rest, we preserve the relative order of custom annotations with regard to the data property. Note that we choose the position of the first property annotation in cases where no data property for a set of property annotations exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.MediaTypeUtils.encodingUtf8NoPreamble
member.summary: UTF-8 encoding, without the BOM preamble.
member.remarks:
While a BOM preamble on UTF8 is generally benign, it seems that some MIME handlers under IE6 will not process the payload correctly when included.
Because the data service should include the encoding as part of the Content-Type in the response, there should be no ambiguity as to what encoding is being used.
For further information, see http://www.unicode.org/faq/utf_bom.html#BOM.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.Metadata.EdmLibraryExtensions.GetCollectionItemTypeName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns Collection item type name or null if the provided type name is not a collection.
member.param: Collection type name.
Whether it is a nested (recursive) call.
member.returns: Collection element type name or null if not a collection.
member.remarks: The following rules are used for collection type names: - it has to start with "Collection(" and end with ")" - trailing and leading whitespaces make the type not to be recognized as collection. - there is to be no characters (including whitespaces) between "Collection" and "(" - otherwise it won't berecognized as collection - collection item type name has to be a non-empty string - i.e. "Collection()" won't be recognized as collection - nested collection - e.g. "Collection(Collection(Edm.Int32))" - are not supported - we will throw Note the following are examples of valid type names which are not collection: - "Collection()" - " Collection(Edm.Int32)" - "Collection (Edm.Int32)" - "Collection("

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataBatchWriter.Microsoft#OData#Core#IODataOutputInStreamErrorListener#OnInStreamError
member.summary: This method notifies the listener, that an in-stream error is to be written.
member.remarks: This listener can choose to fail, if the currently written payload doesn't support in-stream error at this position. If the listener returns, the writer should not allow any more writing, since the in-stream error is the last thing in the payload.

member.summary: The stream for writing the content of an operation has been disposed. The batch writer can now be used again.

member.summary: WriteEndChangeSet has been called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataBatchWriter.BatchWriterState.BatchCompleted
member.summary: WriteEndBatch has been called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataBatchWriter.BatchWriterState.Error

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataCollectionReaderState
member.summary: Enumeration of all possible states of an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataCollectionReaderState.Start
member.summary: The reader is at the start; nothing has been read yet.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataCollectionReaderState.CollectionStart
member.summary: The reader has started reading and is reading the start element of the collection wrapper (if any). No items have been read.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns an instance of .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataCollectionReaderState.Value
member.summary: The reader read an item from the collection.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns the read item (a primitive value, an ODataComplexValue or null).

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataCollectionReaderState.CollectionEnd
member.summary: The reader has finished reading and is reading the end element of the collection wrapper (if any). All items have been read.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns the same instance of as in state CollectionStart.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataCollectionReaderState.Exception
member.summary: The reader has thrown an exception; nothing can be read from the reader anymore.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataCollectionReaderState.Completed
member.summary: The reader has completed; nothing can be read anymore.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState
member.summary: Enumeration of all possible states of an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.Start
member.summary: The reader is at the start; nothing has been read yet.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaFeedStart
member.summary: The start of a delta feed has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an but no properties may be filled in until the DeltaFeedEnd state is reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.FeedEnd
member.summary: The end of a delta feed has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an with all properties filled in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaEntryStart
member.summary: The start of a delta entry has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an but no properties may be filled in until the EntryEnd state is reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaEntryEnd
member.summary: The end of a delta entry has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an with all properties filled in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaDeletedEntry
member.summary: An delta deleted entry was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an which is fully populated. Note that there's no End state for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaLink
member.summary: An delta link was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an which is fully populated. Note that there's no End state for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.DeltaDeletedLink
member.summary: An delta deleted link was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an which is fully populated. Note that there's no End state for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.Exception
member.summary: The reader has thrown an exception; nothing can be read from the reader anymore.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.Completed
member.summary: The reader has completed; nothing can be read anymore.
member.remarks: In this state, the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataDeltaReaderState.ExpandedNavigationProperty
member.summary: An expanded navigation property was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns the current item of the underlying expanded navigation property reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReader.DetectPayloadKind
member.summary: Determines the potential payload kinds and formats of the payload being read and returns it.
member.returns: The set of potential payload kinds and formats for the payload being read by this reader.
member.remarks: When this method is called it first analyzes the content type and determines whether there are multiple matching payload kinds registered for the message's content type. If there are, it then runs the payload kind detection on all formats that have a matching payload kind registered. Note that this method can return multiple results if a payload is valid for multiple payload kinds but will always at most return a single result per payload kind.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReader.DetectPayloadKindAsync
member.summary: Determines the potential payload kinds and formats of the payload being read and returns it.
member.returns: The set of potential payload kinds and formats for the payload being read by this reader.
member.remarks: When this method is called it first analyzes the content type and determines whether there are multiple matching payload kinds registered for the message's content type. If there are, it then runs the payload kind detection on all formats that have a matching payload kind registered. Note that this method can return multiple results if a payload is valid for multiple payload kinds but will always at most return a single result per payload kind.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.EnableWcfDataServicesClientBehavior(System.Func{Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmType,System.String,Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmType})
member.summary: Enables the same behavior that the WCF Data Services client has. Also, lets the user set the values for custom data namespace and type scheme.
member.param: Custom type resolver which takes both expected type and type name. This function is used instead of the IEdmModel.FindType if it's specified. The first parameter to the function is the expected type (the type inferred from the parent property or specified by the external caller). The second parameter is the type name from the payload. The function should return the resolved type, or null if no such type was found.

member.remarks: This URI will be used in ATOM format only, it would overrided by <xml:base /> element in ATOM payload. If the URI does not end with a slash, a slash would be appended automatically.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.DisablePrimitiveTypeConversion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether not to convert all primitive values to the type specified in the model or provided as an expected type. Note that values will still be converted to the type specified in the payload itself.
member.returns: true if primitive values and report values are not converted; false if all primitive values are converted to the type specified in the model or provided as an expected type. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.UndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKinds
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior the reader should use when it finds undeclared property.
member.returns: The behavior the reader should use when it finds undeclared property.
member.remarks:
This setting has no effect if there's no model specified for the reader. This setting must be set to Default when reading request payloads.
Detailed behavior description: ODataUndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKind.Default If an undeclared property is found reading fails.
ODataUndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKind.ReportUndeclaredLinkProperty ATOM - Undeclared deferred navigation link will be read and reported. - Undeclared expanded navigation link will fail. - Undeclared stream property link (both read and edit) will be read and reported. - Undeclared association link will be read and reported. - Undeclared properties inside m:properties fail. Verbose JSON - If an undeclared property is found a detection logic will run: - __deferred value is found - the link will be read and reported as a deferred navigation link. - __mediaresource value is found - the link will be read and reported as a stream property - If nothing from the above matches the reading fails. - Undeclared association links inside __metadata/properties will be read and reported. JSON Light - If an undeclared property is found a detection logic will run: - The property has 'odata.navigationLink' or 'odata.associationLink' annotation on it and no value - it will be read as navigation/association link - The property has 'odata.mediaEditLink', 'odata.mediaReadLink', 'odata.mediaContentType' or 'odata.mediaEtag' on it and no value - it will be read as a stream property. - Any other property (that is property with a value or property with no annotation mentioned above) will fail.
ODataUndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKind.IgnoreUndeclaredValueProperty ATOM - Undeclared property inside m:properties is ignored (not even read). - Undeclared navigation link, stream property link or association link fail. Verbose JSON - If an undeclared property is found a detection logic will run: - __deferred value is found - fail as undeclared deferred nav. link. - __mediaresource value is found - fail as undeclared stream property. - All other properties are ignored and not read. - Undeclared association links inside __metadata/properties fail. JSON Light - If an undeclared property is found a detection logic will run: - The property has 'odata.navigationLink' or 'odata.associationLink' annotation on it (deferred or expanded navigation link) - fail as undeclared navigation property - The property has 'odata.mediaEditLink', 'odata.mediaReadLink', 'odata.mediaContentType' or 'odata.mediaEtag' on it and no value - fail as undeclared stream property. - The property has a value and no annotation mentioned above - the property is ignored and not read.
ODataUndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKind.ReportUndeclaredLinkProperty | ODataUndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKind.IgnoreUndeclaredValueProperty ATOM - Undeclared deferred navigation link will be read and reported. - Undeclared expanded navigation link will be read and the navigation link part will be reported, the expanded content will be ignored and not read or reported. - Undeclared stream property link (both read and edit) will be read and reported. - Undeclared association link will be read and reported. - Undeclared properties inside m:properties will be ignored and not read. Verbose JSON - If an undeclared property is found a detection logic will run: - __deferred value is found - read and report a deferred navigation link. - __mediaresource value is found - read and report stream property. - All other properties are ignore and not read. - Undeclared association links inside __metadata/properties are read and reported. JSON Light - If an undeclared property is found a detection logic will run: - The property has 'odata.navigationLink' or 'odata.associationLink' annotation on it and no value (deferred navigation link) - it will be read as navigation/association link - The property has 'odata.navigationLink' or 'odata.associationLink' annotation on it and with value (expanded navigation link) - it will be read, the navigation and association link will be reported and the content will be ignored. - The property has 'odata.mediaEditLink', 'odata.mediaReadLink', 'odata.mediaContentType' or 'odata.mediaEtag' on it and no value - it will be read as a stream property. - The property has a value and no annotation mentioned above - the property is ignored and not read.
Note that there's one difference between ATOM/JSON Light and Verbose JSON. In ATOM and JSON Light expanded links are treated as both undeclared link and a value property. The URLs are the link part, the expanded content is the value part. In Verbose JSON expanded links are treated as a value property as a whole. Since in JSON expanded links don't actually have the link part (the payload doesn't contain the "href") this is not such a big difference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.DisableMessageStreamDisposal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the message stream will not be disposed after finishing writing with the message.
member.returns: true if the message stream will not be disposed after finishing writing with the message; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.MaxProtocolVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum OData protocol version the reader should accept and understand.
member.returns: The maximum OData protocol version the reader should accept and understand.
member.remarks: If the payload to be read has higher OData-Version than the value specified for this property the reader will fail. Reader will also not report features which require higher version than specified for this property. It may either ignore such features in the payload or fail on them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.EnableFullValidation
member.summary: If set to true, all the validation would be enabled. Else some validation will be skipped. Default to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.UseKeyAsSegment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the reader should put key values in their own URI segment when automatically building URIs. If this value is false, automatically-generated URLs will take the form "../EntitySet('KeyValue')/..". If this value is true, automatically-generated URLs will take the form "../EntitySet/KeyValue/..". If this value is not set (null), decision will be made based on the "Com.Microsoft.OData.Service.Conventions.V1.UrlConventions" vocabulary annotation on the IEdmEntityContainer, if available. The default behavior is to put key values inside parentheses and not a distinct URL segments. This setting only applies to URLs that are automatically generated by the and the URLs explicitly provided by the server won't be modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.MediaTypeResolver
member.summary: The media type resolver to use when interpreting the incoming content type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.ODataSimplified
member.summary: Whether OData Simplified is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageReaderSettings.DisableStrictMetadataValidation
member.summary: false - metadata validation is strict, the input must exactly match against the model. true - metadata validation is lax, the input doesn't have to match the model in all cases. This property has effect only if the metadata model is specified.
member.remarks: Strict metadata validation: Primitive values: The wire type must be convertible to the expected type. Complex values: The wire type must resolve against the model and it must exactly match the expected type. Entities: The wire type must resolve against the model and it must be assignable to the expected type. Collections: The wire type must exactly match the expected type. If no expected type is available we use the payload type. Lax metadata validation: Primitive values: If expected type is available, we ignore the wire type. Complex values: The wire type is used if the model defines it. If the model doesn't define such a type, the expected type is used. If the wire type is not equal to the expected type, but it's assignable, we fail because we don't support complex type inheritance. If the wire type if not assignable we use the expected type. Entities: same as complex values except that if the payload type is assignable we use the payload type. This allows derived entity types. Collections: If expected type is available, we ignore the wire type, except we fail if the item type is a derived complex type. If no expected type is available we use the payload type and it must resolve against the model. If DisablePrimitiveTypeConversion is on, the rules for primitive values don't apply and the primitive values are always read with the type from the wire.

member.summary: Sets the content-type and OData-Version headers on the message used by the message writer. This method can be called if it is important to set all the message headers before calling any of the write (or writer creation) methods on the . If it is sufficient to set the headers when the write (or writer creation) methods on the are called, you don't have to call this method and setting the headers will happen automatically.
member.param: The kind of payload to be written with this message writer.
member.returns: The used for the specified .

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriter.SetOrVerifyHeaders(Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataPayloadKind)
member.summary: If no headers have been set, sets the content-type and OData-Version headers on the message used by the message writer. If headers have been set explicitly (via ODataUtils.SetHeaderForPayload) this method verifies that the payload kind used to create the headers is the same as the one being passed in .
member.param: The kind of payload to be written with this message writer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriter.EnsureODataVersion
member.summary: Ensures that the version of the OData protocol is set.
member.remarks: If a version is specified explicitly on the writer settings, it is used. Otherwise the method tries to read the version from the message headers. If there is a version header but the value cannot be parsed, we fail. If there is no version header, we fall back to the default version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriter.EnsureODataFormatAndContentType
member.summary: Ensures that the OData format is computed and set; if needed, sets the content type header of the message.
member.remarks:
This method computes and ensures that a content type exists and computes the OData format from it. If a content type is explicitly specified through
or it will be used. If no content type is specified in either place, the message headers are checked for a content type header. If the content type is computed from settings, the content type header is set on the message.

member.returns: The document base URI which is used as base for all relative URIs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.ODataUri
member.summary: The OData Uri of an incoming request. Call 's methods, and assign properties (e.g., ) to .

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.DisableMessageStreamDisposal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the message stream will not be disposed after finishing writing with the message.
member.returns: true if the message stream will not be disposed after finishing writing with the message; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.JsonPCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback function use to wrap the response from server.
member.returns: The callback function used to wrap the response from server.
member.remarks: If it has a value and we are writing a JSON response, then we will wrap the entirety of the response in the provided function name and parenthesis for JSONP. Otherwise this value is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.AutoComputePayloadMetadataInJson
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the writer should automatically generate or omit metadata in JSON payloads based on the metadata level.
member.remarks: Payload metadata includes the type names of entries and property values as well as any information that may be computed automatically, such as edit links. If, for example, ODataEntry.EditLink is not specified, then it will be automatically computed and written out in full metadata mode. If ODataEntry.EditLink is specified, then that value will be considered an "override" of the default computed edit link, and will be written out in full and minimal metadata modes. It will not be written in no metadata mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.UseKeyAsSegment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the writer should put key values in their own URI segment when automatically building URIs. If this value is false, automatically-generated URLs will take the form "../EntitySet('KeyValue')/..". If this value is true, automatically-generated URLs will take the form "../EntitySet/KeyValue/..". If this value is not set (null), decision will be made based on the "Com.Microsoft.OData.Service.Conventions.V1.UrlConventions" vocabulary annotation on the IEdmEntityContainer, if available. The default behavior is to put key values inside parentheses and not a distinct URL segments. This setting only applies to URLs that are automatically generated by the and does not modify URLs explicitly provided by the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.EnableFullValidation
member.summary: If set to true, all the validation would be enabled. Else some validation will be skipped. Default to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.MediaTypeResolver
member.summary: The media type resolver to use when interpreting the content type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.ODataSimplified
member.summary: Whether OData Simplified is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.AlwaysUseDefaultXmlNamespaceForRootElement
member.summary: If set to true, then the root element of each payload will be written in the default (non-prefix-qualified) namespace of the document. All other elements in the same namespace will also not have prefixes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.AcceptableMediaTypes
member.summary: The acceptable media types used to determine the content type of the message. This is a comma separated list of content types as specified in RFC 2616, Section 14.1
member.remarks: A null or empty accept header means that all content types are acceptable.
For response messages this is usually the 'Accept' header of the request message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.AcceptableCharsets
member.summary: The acceptable charsets used to the determine the encoding of the message. This is a comma separated list of charsets as specified in RFC 2616, Section 14.2
member.remarks: A null or empty accept charset header means that all charsets are acceptable.
For response messages this is usually the 'Accept-Charset' header of the request message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.WriterBehavior
member.summary: The writer behavior that holds all the knobs needed to make the writer behave differently inside and outside of WCF Data Services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMessageWriterSettings.Format
member.summary: The format to use when writing the payload; this replaces the 'AcceptHeader' and 'AcceptCharSetHeader' properties and uses the default values for the respective format. If null is specified the default format and the default media type will be picked depending on the writer these settings are used with.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataMetadataOutputContext.WriteInStreamError(Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataError,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes an into the message payload.
member.param: The error to write.
A flag indicating whether debug information (e.g., the inner error from the ) should be included in the payload. This should only be used in debug scenarios.
member.remarks: This method is called if the ODataMessageWriter.WriteError is called once some other write operation has already started. The method should write the in-stream error representation for the specific format into the current payload. Before the method is called no flush is performed on the output context or any active writer. It is the responsibility of this method to flush the output before the method returns.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState
member.summary: Enumeration of all possible states of an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState.Start
member.summary: The reader is at the start; nothing has been read yet.
member.remarks: In this state the Name and Value properties of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState.Value
member.summary: The reader read a primitive or a complex parameter.
member.remarks: In this state the Name property of the returns the name of the parameter and the Value property of the returns the value read (e.g. a primitive value, an ODataComplexValue or null).

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState.Collection
member.summary: The reader is reading a collection parameter.
member.remarks: In this state the Name property of the returns the name of the parameter and the Value property of the returns null. The CreateCollectionReader() method on the must be called to get the reader to read the collection value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState.Exception
member.summary: The reader has thrown an exception; nothing can be read from the reader anymore.
member.remarks: In this state the Name and Value properties of the return null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState.Completed
member.summary: The reader has completed; nothing can be read anymore.
member.remarks: In this state the Name and Value properties of the return null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState.Entry
member.summary: The reader is reading an entry parameter.
member.remarks: In this state the Name property of the returns the name of the parameter and the Value property of the returns null. The CreateEntryReader() method on the must be called to get the reader to read the entry value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataParameterReaderState.Feed
member.summary: The reader is reading a feed parameter.
member.remarks: In this state the Name property of the returns the name of the parameter and the Value property of the returns null. The CreateFeedReader() method on the must be called to get the reader to read the feed value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataPreferenceHeader.ReturnContent
member.summary: Property to get and set the "return=representation" and "return=minimal" preferences to the "Prefer" header on the underlying IODataRequestMessage or the "Preference-Applied" header on the underlying IODataResponseMessage. Setting true sets the "return=representation" preference and clears the "return=minimal" preference. Setting false sets the "return=minimal" preference and clears the "return=representation" preference. Setting null clears the "return=representation" and "return=minimal" preferences. Returns true if the "return=representation" preference is on the header. Otherwise returns false if the "return=minimal" is on the header. Returning null indicates that "return=representation" and "return=minimal" are not on the header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataPreferenceHeader.AnnotationFilter
member.summary:
Property to get and set the "odata.include-annotations" preference with the given filter to the "Prefer" header on the underlying IODataRequestMessage or the "Preference-Applied" header on the underlying IODataResponseMessage. If the "odata-annotations" preference is already on the header, set replaces the existing instance. Returning null indicates that the "odata.include-annotations" preference is not on the header.
The filter string may be a comma delimited list of any of the following supported patterns: "*" -- Matches all annotation names. "ns.*" -- Matches all annotation names under the namespace "ns". "ns.name" -- Matches only the annotation name "ns.name". "-" -- The exclude operator may be used with any of the supported pattern, for example: "-ns.*" -- Excludes all annotation names under the namespace "ns". "-ns.name" -- Excludes only the annotation name "ns.name". Null or empty filter is equivalent to "-*".
The relative priority of the pattern is base on the relative specificity of the patterns being compared. If pattern1 is under the namespace pattern2, pattern1 is more specific than pattern2 because pattern1 matches a subset of what pattern2 matches. We give higher priority to the pattern that is more specific. For example: "ns.*" has higher priority than "*" "ns.name" has higher priority than "ns.*" "ns1.name" has same priority as "ns2.*"
Patterns with the exclude operator takes higher precedence than the same pattern without. For example: "-ns.name" has higher priority than "ns.name".
Examples: "ns1.*,ns.name" -- Matches any annotation name under the "ns1" namespace and the "ns.name" annotation. "*,-ns.*,ns.name" -- Matches any annotation name outside of the "ns" namespace and only "ns.name" under the "ns" namespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataPreferenceHeader.RespondAsync
member.summary: Property to get and set the "respond-async" preference to the "Prefer" header on the underlying IODataRequestMessage or the "Preference-Applied" header on the underlying IODataResponseMessage. Setting true sets the "respond-async" preference. Setting false clears the "respond-async" preference. Returns true if the "respond-async" preference is on the header. Otherwise returns false if the "respond-async" is not on the header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataPreferenceHeader.Wait
member.summary: Property to get and set the "wait" preference to the "Prefer" header on the underlying IODataRequestMessage or the "Preference-Applied" header on the underlying IODataResponseMessage. Setting N sets the "wait=N" preference. Setting null clears the "wait" preference. Returns N if the "wait=N" preference is on the header. Returning null indicates that "wait" is not on the header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataPreferenceHeader.ContinueOnError
member.summary: Property to get and set the "odata.continue-on-error" preference to the "Prefer" header on the underlying IODataRequestMessage or the "Preference-Applied" header on the underlying IODataResponseMessage. Setting true sets the "odata.continue-on-error" preference. Setting false clears the "odata.continue-on-error" preference. Returns true of the "odata.continue-on-error" preference is on the header. Otherwise returns false if the "odata.continue-on-error" is not on the header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataPreferenceHeader.MaxPageSize

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataRawOutputContext.Flush
member.summary: Synchronously flush the writer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataRawOutputContext.FlushAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously flush the writer.
member.returns: Task which represents the pending flush operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataRawOutputContext.WriteInStreamError(Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataError,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes an into the message payload.
member.param: The error to write.
A flag indicating whether debug information (e.g., the inner error from the ) should be included in the payload. This should only be used in debug scenarios.
member.remarks: This method is called if the ODataMessageWriter.WriteError is called once some other write operation has already started. The method should write the in-stream error representation for the specific format into the current payload. Before the method is called no flush is performed on the output context or any active writer. It is the responsibility of this method to flush the output before the method returns.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataRawOutputContext.WriteInStreamErrorAsync(Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataError,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes an into the message payload.
member.param: The error to write.
A flag indicating whether debug information (e.g., the inner error from the ) should be included in the payload. This should only be used in debug scenarios.
member.returns: Task which represents the pending write operation.
member.remarks: This method is called if the ODataMessageWriter.WriteError is called once some other write operation has already started. The method should write the in-stream error representation for the specific format into the current payload. Before the method is called no flush is performed on the output context or any active writer. It is the responsibility of this method to make sure that all the data up to this point are written before the in-stream error is written. It is the responsibility of this method to flush the output before the task finishes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderBehavior
member.summary: Class that captures all the information needed to make readers behave differently when used inside of WCF Data Services or outside.

member.summary: The default reader behavior for the OData library.

member.summary: The API behavior kind of this behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderBehavior.typeResolver
member.summary: Custom type resolver used by the WCF DS Client.
member.remarks: This function is used instead of calling the IEdmModel.FindType. The first parameter to the function is the expected type (the type infered from the parent property or specified by the external caller). The second parameter is the type name from the payload. The function should return the resolved type, or null if no such type was found.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderBehavior.allowDuplicatePropertyNames
member.summary: If set to true, allows the writers to write duplicate properties of entries and complex values (i.e., properties that have the same name). Defaults to 'false'.

member.summary: The format behavior kind of this behavior.

member.summary: Determines whether operations bound to the given type must be container qualified.

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The format behavior kind of this behavior.
The API behavior kind of this behavior.
If set to true, allows the writers to write duplicate properties of entries and complex values (i.e., properties that have the same name). Defaults to 'false'.

Custom type resolver which takes both expected type and type name. This function is used instead of the IEdmModel.FindType is it's specified. The first parameter to the function is the expected type (the type infered from the parent property or specified by the external caller). The second parameter is the type name from the payload. The function should return the resolved type, or null if no such type was found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderBehavior.CreateWcfDataServicesClientBehavior(System.Func{Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmType,System.String,Microsoft.OData.Edm.IEdmType})
member.summary: Create the reader behavior for the WCF Data Services client.
member.param: Custom type resolver which takes both expected type and type name. This function is used instead of the IEdmModel.FindType is it's specified. The first parameter to the function is the expected type (the type infered from the parent property or specified by the external caller). The second parameter is the type name from the payload. The function should return the resolved type, or null if no such type was found.
member.returns: The created reader behavior.

member.summary: Get the default reader behavior for the OData library.
member.returns: The default reader behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderBehavior.AllowDuplicatePropertyNames
member.summary: If set to true, allows the writers to write duplicate properties of entries and complex values (i.e., properties that have the same name). Defaults to 'false'.
member.remarks: Independently of this setting duplicate property names are never allowed if one of the duplicate property names refers to a named stream property, an association link or a collection.

member.summary: Custom type resolver used by the WCF DS Client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState
member.summary: Enumeration of all possible states of an .

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.Start
member.summary: The reader is at the start; nothing has been read yet.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.FeedStart
member.summary: The start of a feed has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an but no properties may be filled in until the FeedEnd state is reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.FeedEnd
member.summary: The end of a feed has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an with all properties filled in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.EntryStart
member.summary: The start of an entry has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an but no properties may be filled in until the EntryEnd state is reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.EntryEnd
member.summary: The end of an entry has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an with all properties filled in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.NavigationLinkStart
member.summary: The start of a navigation link has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an but no properties may be filled in until the LinkEnd state is reached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.NavigationLinkEnd
member.summary: The end of a navigation link has been read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an with all properties filled in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.EntityReferenceLink
member.summary: An entity reference link was read.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns an which is fully populated. Note that there's no End state for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.Exception
member.summary: The reader has thrown an exception; nothing can be read from the reader anymore.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataReaderState.Completed
member.summary: The reader has completed; nothing can be read anymore.
member.remarks: In this state the Item property of the returns null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataUndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKinds.IgnoreUndeclaredValueProperty
member.summary: The reader will skip reading the property if it's not declared by the model and the current type is not open.
member.remarks: This flag can only be used when reading responses. All information about the undeclared property is going to be ignored, so for example ATOM metadata related to that property will not be reported either.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataUndeclaredPropertyBehaviorKinds.ReportUndeclaredLinkProperty
member.summary: The reader will read and report link properties which are not declared by the model.
member.remarks:
This flag can only be used when reading responses. If a link property in the payload is defined in the model it will be read as usual. If it is not declared it will still be read and reported, but it won't be validated against the model.
Link properties are: - Navigation links - Association links - Stream properties

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.ODataUtils.CreateAnnotationFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Translates the to a func that would evalutate whether the filter would match a given annotation name. The func would evaluate to true if the matches the annotation name that's passed to the it, and false otherwise.
member.param:
The filter string may be a comma delimited list of any of the following supported patterns: "*" -- Matches all annotation names. "ns.*" -- Matches all annotation names under the namespace "ns". "ns.name" -- Matches only the annotation name "ns.name". "-" -- The exclude operator may be used with any of the supported pattern, for example: "-ns.*" -- Excludes all annotation names under the namespace "ns". "-ns.name" -- Excludes only the annotation name "ns.name". Null or empty filter is equivalent to "-*".
The relative priority of the pattern is base on the relative specificity of the patterns being compared. If pattern1 is under the namespace pattern2, pattern1 is more specific than pattern2 because pattern1 matches a subset of what pattern2 matches. We give higher priority to the pattern that is more specific. For example: "ns.*" has higher priority than "*" "ns.name" has higher priority than "ns.*" "ns1.name" has same priority as "ns2.*"
Patterns with the exclude operator takes higher precedence than the same pattern without. For example: "-ns.name" has higher priority than "ns.name".
Examples: "ns1.*,ns.name" -- Matches any annotation name under the "ns1" namespace and the "ns.name" annotation. "*,-ns.*,ns.name" -- Matches any annotation name outside of the "ns" namespace and only "ns.name" under the "ns" namespace.
member.returns: Returns a func which would evaluate to true if the matches the annotation name that's passed to the it, and false otherwise.

member.param: The name of the header to append default values.

member.returns: The header value string with appended default values.

member.summary: Disposes the RawValueWriter. It flushes itself and then disposes its inner TextWriter.

member.summary: Start writing a raw output. This should only be called once.

member.summary: End the writing of a raw output. This should be the last thing called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.RawValueWriter.WriteRawValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the specified into its raw format and writes it to the output. The value has to be of enumeration or primitive type. Only one WriteRawValue call should be made before this object gets disposed.
member.param: The (non-binary) value to write.
member.remarks: We do not accept binary values here; WriteBinaryValue should be used for binary data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.RawValueWriter.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the RawValueWriter. The call gets pushed to the TextWriter (if there is one). In production code, this is StreamWriter.Flush, which turns into Stream.Flush. In the synchronous case the underlying stream is the message stream itself, which will then Flush as well. In the async case the underlying stream is the async buffered stream, which ignores Flush call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.RawValueWriter.InitializeTextWriter
member.summary: Initialized a new text writer over the message payload stream.
member.remarks: This can only be called if the text writer was not yet initialized or it has been closed. It can be called several times with CloseWriter calls in between though.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.RawValueWriter.TextWriter
member.summary: Gets the text writer.

member.summary: Resolves and validates the payload type against the expected type and returns the target type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.SerializationTypeNameAnnotation
member.summary: Annotation which stores the type name to serialize.
member.remarks: This annotation will be recognized on ODataEntry, ODataComplexValue, ODataCollectionValue and ODataPrimitiveValue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.SerializationTypeNameAnnotation.TypeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the type name to serialize, for the annotated item.
member.returns: The type name to serialize, for the annotated item.
member.remarks: If this property is null, no type name will be written. If this property is non-null, the property value will be used as the type name written to the payload. If this annotation is present, it always overrides the type name specified on the annotated item. If this annotation is not present, the value of the TypeName property on the ODataEntry, ODataComplexValue or ODataCollectionValue is used as the type name in the payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.TaskUtils.FollowOnSuccessWithTask(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Returns a new task which will consist of the followed by a call to the which will only be invoked if the antecendent task succeeded.
member.param: The task to "append" the operation to.
The operation to execute if the succeeded.
member.returns: A new task which represents the antecedent task followed by a conditional invoke to the operation.
member.remarks: This method unlike ContinueWith will return a task which will fail if the antecedent task fails, thus it propagates failures. This method handles operation which returns another task. The method will unwrap and return a task which finishes when both the antecedent task, the operation as well as the task returned by that operation finished.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.TaskUtils.FollowAlwaysWith(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Action{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Returns a new task which will consist of the followed by a call to the which will get called no matter what the result of the antecedent task was.
member.param: The task to "append" the operation to.
The operation to execute after the finished.
member.returns: A new task which represents the antecedent task followed by an invoke to the operation.
member.remarks: This method unlike ContinueWith will return a task which will fail if the antecedent task fails, thus it propagates failures. Note that the operation may not return any value, since the original result of the antecedent task will be used always. Also if the operation fails, the resulting task fails. If both tasks fail, the antecedent task failure is reported only.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.Parsers.SelectExpandBinder
member.summary: ExpandOption variant of an SelectExpandBinder, where the default selection item for a given level is based on the select at that level instead of the top level select clause. If nothing is selected for a given expand in the ExpandOption syntax, then we by default select all from that item, instead of selecting nothing (and therefore pruning the expand off of the tree).

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ExpressionLexer
member.summary: Use this class to parse an expression in the OData URI format.
member.remarks:
Literals (non-normative "handy" reference - see spec for correct expression): Null null Boolean true | false Int32 (digit+) Int64 (digit+)[L|l] Decimal (digit+ ['.' digit+])[M|m] Float (digit+ ['.' digit+][e|E [+|-] digit+)[f|F] Double (digit+ ['.' digit+][e|E [+|-] digit+)[d|D] String "'" .* "'" DateTime datetime"'"dddd-dd-dd[T|' ']dd:mm[ss[.fffffff]]"'" DateTimeOffset dddd-dd-dd[T|' ']dd:mm[ss[.fffffff]]-dd:mm Duration time"'"dd:mm[ss[.fffffff]]"'" Binary (binary|X)'digit*' GUID 8HEXDIG "-" 4HEXDIG "-" 4HEXDIG "-" 4HEXDIG "-" 12HEXDIG
Note: ABNF v4.0 actually has forbidden numeric string's trailing L,M,F,D though we allow them to be optional http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.0/cs01/abnf/odata-abnf-construction-rules.txt decimalValue = [SIGN] 1*DIGIT ["." 1*DIGIT] doubleValue = decimalValue [ "e" [SIGN] 1*DIGIT ] / nanInfinity ; with restricted number range singleValue = doubleValue ; with restricted number range nanInfinity = 'NaN' / '-INF' / 'INF'

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ExpressionLexer.AdvanceThroughExpandOption
member.summary: Advances the lexer until a semicolon, an unbalanced close parens occurs, or the text ends. Any string literals (text in single quotes) will be skipped when checking for delimiters. The CurrentToken of the lexer after this method call will be whatever comes after the advanced text.
member.returns: All of the text that was read.

member.name: M:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ExpressionLexer.AdvanceThroughBalancedParentheticalExpression
member.summary: Advances through a balanced expression that we do not want to parse, beginning with a '(' and ending with a ')'.
member.remarks: 1. This method will identify and advance through inner pairs of parenthesis. 2. The lexer is expected to have a CurrentToken which is the open parenthesis at the start, meaning that we are positioned on the first character of the expression inside that. 3. When we are done we will be right after the closing ')', but we will have have set CurrentToken to anything. For this reason, you probably want to call NextToken() after this method, since CurrentToken wil be garbage.
member.returns: The parenthesis expression, including the outer parenthesis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ODataUriParserSettings.MaximumExpansionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth of the tree that results from parsing $expand.
member.remarks: This will be validated after parsing completes, and so should not be used to prevent the instantiation of large trees. Further, redundant expansions will be pruned before validation and will not count towards the maximum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ODataUriParserSettings.MaximumExpansionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of instances that can appear in the tree that results from parsing $expand.
member.remarks: This will be validated after parsing completes, and so should not be used to prevent the instantiation of large trees. Further, redundant expansions will be pruned before validation and will not count towards the maximum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ODataUriParserSettings.SelectExpandLimit
member.summary: Gets or Sets the maximum recursive depth for a select and expand clause, which limits the maximum depth of the tree that can be parsed by the syntactic parser. This guarantees a set level of performance.
member.remarks: The number here doesn't necessarily correspond exactly with the actual maximum recursive depth of the syntactic tree, i.e a limit of 20 doesn't necessarily mean that a tree will have depth exactly 20, it may have depth 10 (but never over 20). Think of it more as an upper bound.
member.exception: Throws if the input value is negative.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ODataUriParserSettings.FilterLimit
member.summary: Gets or Sets the limit on the maximum depth of the filter tree that can be parsed by the syntactic parser. This guarantees a set level of performance.
member.remarks: The number here doesn't necessarily correspond exactly with the actual maximum recursive depth of the syntactic tree, i.e a limit of 20 doesn't necessarily mean that a tree will have depth exactly 20, it may have depth 10 (but never over 20). Think of it more as an upper bound.
member.exception: Throws if the input value is negative.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ODataUriParserSettings.OrderByLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum recursive depth for an orderby clause, which limits the maximum depth of the tree that can be parsed by the syntactic parser. This guarantees a set level of performance.
member.remarks: The number here doesn't necessarily correspond exactly with the actual maximum recursive depth of the syntactic tree, i.e a limit of 20 doesn't necessarily mean that a tree will have depth exactly 20, it may have depth 10 (but never over 20). Think of it more as an upper bound.
member.exception: Throws if the input value is negative.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ODataUriParserSettings.PathLimit
member.summary: Gets or Sets the limit on the maximum number of segments that can be parsed by the syntactic parser. This guarantees a set level of performance.
member.remarks: Unlike Filter, OrderBy, and SelectExpand, this Limit is more concrete, and will limit the segments to exactly the number that is specified... i.e. a limit of 20 will throw if and only if there are more than 20 segments in the path.
member.exception: Throws if the input value is negative.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.ODataUriParserSettings.SearchLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum recursive depth for an search clause, which limits the maximum depth of the tree that can be parsed by the syntactic parser. This guarantees a set level of performance.
member.remarks: The number here doesn't necessarily correspond exactly with the actual maximum recursive depth of the syntactic tree, i.e a limit of 20 doesn't necessarily mean that a tree will have depth exactly 20, it may have depth 10 (but never over 20). Think of it more as an upper bound.
member.exception: Throws if the input value is negative.

member.summary: Parser that knows how to parse expand options that could come after the path part of an expand term. Delegates to other parsing code as needed. member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.SearchLexer.InvalidWordPattern
member.summary:
Pattern for searchWord From ABNF rule: searchWord = 1*ALPHA ; Actually: any character from the Unicode categories L or Nl, ; but not the words AND, OR, and NOT
\p{L} means any kind of letter from any language, include [Lo] such as CJK single character.

member.name: T:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.Semantic.UriTemplateExpression
member.summary: The class representing the URI Template parsing result.
member.remarks:
A URI Template is a string wrapped in brackets, it is capable for describing a range of Uniform Resource Identifiers. The URI Template can be used for both building and parsing URI. Set the EnableUriTemplateParsing property of to true, to enable parsing the Uri template.
For example, in the following URI http://example.org/service/Customers({CID}) {CID} is a validate Uri template for Customers' ID segment, in the parsing result of , would be the original literal "{CID}", and would be the actual type for Customers' ID.
See RFC6570 for detail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.Semantic.UriTemplateExpression.LiteralText
member.summary: The original text for the Uri template.

member.name: P:Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.Semantic.UriTemplateExpression.ExpectedType
member.summary: The expected type of the object which the Uri template stands for.

member.remarks: The check is host agnostic. For example, "http://host1.com/Service.svc" is a valid base Uri of "https://host2.org/Service.svc/Bla" but is not a valid base for "http://host1.com/OtherService.svc/Bla".

The specified Uri instance to test.
member.returns: true if the baseUri Uri instance is a base of uri; otherwise false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.BindingFlags.FlattenHierarchy
member.summary: Specifies that public and protected static members up the hierarchy should be returned. Private static members in inherited classes are not returned. Static members include fields, methods, events, and properties. Nested types are not returned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.BindingFlags.ExactBinding
member.summary: Specifies that types of the supplied arguments must exactly match the types of the corresponding formal parameters. Reflection throws an exception if the caller supplies a non-null Binder object, since that implies that the caller is supplying BindToXXX implementations that will pick the appropriate method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.OData.Core.BindingFlags.OptionalParamBinding
member.summary: Returns the set of members whose parameter count matches the number of supplied arguments. This binding flag is used for methods with parameters that have default values and methods with variable arguments (varargs). This flag should only be used with System.Type.InvokeMember(System.String,System.Reflection.BindingFlags,System.Reflection.Binder,System.Object,System.Object[],System.Reflection.ParameterModifier[],System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.String[]).
